definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Of these 15 people to smallpox to the Easter Island.
sentences.chinese: 这15人也把天花带到了复活节岛。

sentences.english: Archaeologists have solved an ancient mystery surrounding the famous Easter Island statues.
sentences.chinese: 考古学家发现著名的复活节岛巨古石像的秘密。

sentences.english: The island chiefs had competed to erect ever bigger statues.
sentences.chinese: 复活节岛的领主们竞相修建更大的石像。

sentences.english: Giant stone moai stand on Easter Island's stony slopes.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的莫埃石像矗立在复活节岛的石坡上。

sentences.english: People in the Galapagos and on Easter Island have already taken refuge.
sentences.chinese: 在加拉帕戈斯和复活节岛的人们已采取避难措施。

sentences.english: The famous stone monoliths of Easter Island weigh an average of 14 tons each.
sentences.chinese: 著名的复活节岛巨石像，平均每个重达14吨。

sentences.english: Seeing these stone men reminds me of those colossal stone sculptures on Easter Island.
sentences.chinese: 看到这些石人我想到了复活节岛上的那些巨型石雕。

sentences.english: When those first colonizers discovered Easter Island, this was a paradise.
sentences.chinese: 当第一批开拓者发现复活节岛时，这里是个天堂。

pinyin: Jia1 la1 pa4 ge1 si1 Qun2 dao3
Ma3 da2 jia1 si1 jia1 Dao3

definition: Uluru, massive sandstone outcrop in central Australia
Flores, Indonesia/also written 弗洛里斯島|弗洛里斯岛[Fu2 luo4 li3 si1 dao3]
